'Crotonic acid', or trans-2-butenoic acid, is a short-chain unsaturated
carboxylic acid, described by the formula CH 3CH=CHCO 2H.
Crotonic acid is so named because it was erroneously thought to be a
saponification product of croton oil. It crystallizes as needles from hot water.

Racemic threonine can be prepared from crotonic acid by alpha-functionalization
using mercury(II) acetate.
